com.nair.cache.expirable

Class ExpirableCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nair.cache.expirable.ExpirableCache<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the types of Keys that are stored in the Map. Keys get wrapped in an instance of ExpirableCacheKey
    V - the types of Values that are mapped. Values get wrapped in an instance of ExpirableCacheValue
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IExpirableCache<K,V>

    public class ExpirableCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpirableCache<K,V>
    The storage engine for an Expirable Cache.
    Author:
    vaishakh

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ExpirableCacheCleaner<K,V> cacheCleaner
      The Parallel thread which is used to remove keys from the Cache that have been expired
      private java.util.Map<ExpirableCacheKey<K>,ExpirableCacheValue<ExpirableCacheKey<K>,V>> dataMap
      The mapping of keys to values
      private java.util.concurrent.DelayQueue<ExpirableCacheKey<K>> delayQueue
      The queue which manages expiry of all keys
      private long timeOut
      The default TTL on keys in the Cache
      private java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit
      The units in which above TTL is calculated

      Used to create an instance of the Expirable Cache

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpirableCache

        public ExpirableCache(long timeOut,
              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Used to create an instance of the Expirable Cache
        Parameters:
        timeOut - the default TTL for each Key
        timeUnit - the units in which TTL is calculated

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public V getValue(K k)
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface IExpirableCache<K,V>

      • putValue

        public void putValue(K k,
            V v,
            long timeOut,
            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Used to Put a value to the cache
        Parameters:
        k - the key. This gets wrapped in ExpirableCacheKey
        v - the value. This gets wrapped in ExpirableCacheValue
        timeOut - The TTL to be set on the key. It overrides the default TTL.
        timeUnit - the units in which above TTL is calculated.

      • putValue

        public void putValue(K key,
            V value)
        Used to Put a value to the cache
        Parameters:
        key - the key. This gets wrapped in ExpirableCacheKey
        value - the value. This gets wrapped in ExpirableCacheValue

        Used to populate this Cache with data from an already existing Expirable Cache
        Parameters:
        existingCache - the existing Expirable Cache

        Used to Flush the data stored in the Cache

        Used to initiate the storage engine for the Expirable Cache

      • getActiveElements

        public int getActiveElements()
        Used to get the number of elements currently residing in the cache
        Returns:
        the number of cached elements

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Used to shutdown the cache. This finalizes the Cache. Only call this method if this Cache is no longer required in the lifecycle of the application. It cannot be used after this method has been invoked.

      • releaseData

        private void releaseData()
        Releases all data stored in the Cache

      • stopCleanup

        private void stopCleanup()
        Stops clean up of the Cache
